metadata.title: Network Operating Systems and Administration
metadata.prerequisite: CSC117 (Computer Network Fundamentals) OR CSC116 (Information & Communication Technology Essentials) - Advisory

description.catalog: This course will provide students with the knowledge and skills required to maintain reliable computer systems in a multi-user environment. The student will learn about system hardware, software, storage, best practices, disaster recovery, and troubleshooting, with additional coverage of virtualization, cloud technologies, security, and scalability.
description.expanded: Students will gain hands-on experience with both Linux and Windows Server administration, learning to configure network services, implement directory services, manage storage systems, and secure enterprise servers. Emphasis is placed on real-world scenarios and industry best practices.

purpose.why: This course prepares you for careers in system administration, network engineering, and IT infrastructure management. You'll develop the practical skills needed to manage enterprise servers, implement security controls, and maintain critical business systems. These competencies align with industry certifications like CompTIA Server+, Linux Professional Institute, and Microsoft certification paths.
purpose.beyond: Beyond technical skills, you'll develop troubleshooting methodologies and the ability to design resilient infrastructure solutionsâ€”capabilities essential for any IT professional.

slos: Manage and maintain servers, including operating system (OS) configuration, access control and virtualization.
Apply physical and network data security techniques.
Configure systems for network connectivity, including physical and logical elements.
Describe disaster recovery and implement backup techniques.

phases.title: Phase 1: Foundations (Weeks 1-5)
phases.description: Build foundational knowledge of server hardware, OS installation, and command-line administration

topics: Server roles in modern IT infrastructure
assignments: Lab 1: Lab Environment Setup & Server Form Factors (26 pts)
Quiz 1: Course Introduction & Server Fundamentals (10 pts)

topics: Server hardware components (CPU, RAM, storage, NICs)
assignments: Lab 2: Server Hardware Configuration & Monitoring (26 pts)

topics: Linux distributions for servers (Ubuntu Server, CentOS/Rocky Linux)
Basic system navigation and file structure
assignments: Lab 3: Linux Server Installation & Basic Administration (27 pts)

topics: Windows Server installation and initial configuration
Windows Server roles and features overview
assignments: Lab 4: Windows Server Installation & Server Manager (26 pts)
Discussion 4: Linux vs. Windows Server (4 pts)
Lab 5: Command Line Administration & Scripting (27 pts)

phases.title: Phase 2: User & File Management (Weeks 6-7)
phases.description: Master user administration, group management, and file system permissions

topics: User account creation and management (Linux & Windows)

phases.title: Phase 3: Networking & Services (Weeks 8-9)
phases.description: Configure network connectivity, services, and security

assignments: Lab 9: Network Services (DHCP, DNS, Firewall) (27 pts)

phases.title: Phase 4: Storage & Directory Services (Weeks 10-12)
phases.description: Implement storage solutions and centralized directory services

topics: Logical Volume Management (LVM, Windows Storage Spaces)
Storage capacity planning and growth strategies
weeks.notes: SPRING BREAK follows this week (3/30/2026 - 4/5/2026) - No classes

topics: Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) concepts
Organizational Units (OUs) and Group Policy basics
User and group management in LDAP

phases.title: Phase 5: Advanced Topics (Weeks 13-15)
phases.description: Explore virtualization, security hardening, and disaster recovery

topics: Introduction to cloud computing (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS)
Data encryption and secure storage disposal
High availability and fault tolerance concepts

phases.title: Phase 6: Troubleshooting & Integration (Weeks 16-17)
phases.description: Master troubleshooting methodologies and complete comprehensive integration project

weeks.notes: No quiz or discussion this week - focus on final project
PROJECT 3 DUE and FINAL EXAM - Comprehensive coverage

breakdown.description: Weekly hands-on lab activities (15 labs @ 26-27 pts each = 400 pts)
Midterm (Week 9) and Final Exam (Week 17) - 125 pts each = 250 pts
Weekly online quizzes (15 quizzes @ 10 pts each = 150 pts, lowest dropped)
Three major integration projects (3 projects @ 50 pts each = 150 pts)
Weekly discussion forums (15 discussions @ 3-4 pts each = 50 pts)

required: Access to computer with virtualization capability (VMware, VirtualBox, or similar)
Various open educational resources and vendor documentation (provided via Canvas)
optional: CompTIA Server+ Certification All-in-One Exam Guide (Lachance, McGraw Hill, 2021)
CompTIA Server+ Study Guide - available from CompTIA Learning

importantDates.description: Comprehensive Integration Project and Final Exam

workload.breakdown: 2 hrs lecture + 3 hrs lab + 4 hrs out-of-class work

policies.attendance: Regular participation expected. Lab work requires consistent engagement.
policies.lateWork: Labs: 10% penalty per day (max 3 days). Projects: 10% penalty per day (max 5 days). Quizzes: no late submissions (lowest dropped). Discussions: 50% credit within 3 days.
policies.makeupExams: No makeup exams except documented emergencies. Must achieve minimum 60% on final to pass course.
policies.academicIntegrity: All work must be your own. Collaboration encouraged for learning, but submissions must be individual. Violations result in zero on assignment and possible course failure.
